events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred on April 9th involving a rear-end collision with another vehicle.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on the report describing the vehicle collision details provided by the claimant.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage the auto accident claim to ensure timely follow-up with the policyholder.
The claim acknowledgment was sent to the customer confirming receipt and outlining the next steps for the auto accident case.
The claimant was asked to submit photographs of the vehicle damage along with the police report and repair estimate for evaluation.
Customer submitted all requested documents including photos, police report, and a mechanic's damage assessment report.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted documentation and police reports to verify the details of the car collision.
Investigation concluded confirming the claimant was not at fault in the vehicle accident; damages corresponded to reported collision.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover the repair costs and rental car expenses based on the damage assessment.
The claimant responded positively accepting the proposed settlement and expressed appreciation for the support provided.
The claim was formally approved by the insurance company to proceed with issuing the payment for vehicle repairs.
Payment was issued to the repair shop and rental company to cover the costs associated with the accident damages.
The claim was officially closed after the customer confirmed completion of repairs and satisfaction with the settlement.
The entire auto accident claim file was archived securely for record-keeping and future reference purposes.
